# Loretta (Warrenton, Virginia)

| designated_other1_number       = 030-0035
| designated_other1_num_position = bottom

| caption                        =
| location                       = East side of US 17, 3,500 feet (1,100 m) north of Warrenton town limits, near Warrenton, Virginia
| coordinates                    =

| built                          = c. , 1907-1908

| refnum                         = 93001442

Loretta, also known as Edmonium, is a historic home located near Warrenton, Fauquier County, Virginia.  The house was originally constructed about 1800 as a two-story. single-pile dwelling.  In 1907â€“1908, it was remodeled in the Colonial Revival style. It is a -story, L-shaped, three-bay, brick house with a hipped roof built over a raised basement. In addition to the main house the property includes a smokehouse, and a well, both of which date to the early 19th century; and two barns, a corncrib, and two tenant houses, which all date to the early 20th century.
It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1993.
